required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anti-CD19/BCMA Bispecific CAR-T Cell Therapy for R/R POMES
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Clinical Trial of Human CD19/BCMA Bispecific CAR-T Cell Therapy for Subjects With Relapsed and Refractory POMES Syndrome.

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this clinical trial is to study the feasibility and efficacy of anti-CD19/BCMA bispecific chimeric antigen receptors (CARs) T cell therapy for relapsed and refractory POMES Syndrome.

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary Objectives
1. To determine the feasibility ad safety of anti-CD19/BCMA CAR-T cells in treating patients with relapsed and refractory POMES Syndrome.
Secondary Objectives
1. To access the efficacy of anti-CD19/BCMA CAR-T cells in patients with POMES Syndrome.
2. To determine in vivo dynamics and persistency of anti-CD19/BCMA CAR-T cells.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety measured by occurrence of study related adverse effects defined by NCI CTCAE 4.0
primary_outcome.description: Safety measured by occurrence of study related adverse effects defined by NCI CTCAE 4.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall complete remission rate defined by the standard response criteria for POMES Syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: Overall complete remission rate defined by the standard response criteria for POMES Syndrome

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of CAR-positive T cells in circulation
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of CAR-positive T cells in circulation

arm_group.description: Administration with anti-CD19/BCMA CAR-T cells in the relapsed and refractory POMES Syndrome patients

intervention.description: Retroviral vector-transduced autologous T cells to express anti-CD19 and anti-BCMA CARs
